feed.title: Leiboff does Research
feed.subtitle: The Leiboff Lab website. We use genetics to understand grass development. Home of COGS RNAseq for maize tassel and sorghum panicle datasets.

entry.title: Summer genetics nursery starts now!
entry.content: There was sun, there was rain, but these folks smiled through the whole thing. Super excited to get our field planted. This is going to be a weird one! Hundreds of interesting maize mutants and diverse corn and sorghum from around the world. So many hopes and dreams for all these little kernels. Hope they do great!
entry.summary: There was sun, there was rain, but these folks smiled through the whole thing. Super excited to get our field planted. This is going to be a weird one! Hundreds of interesting maize mutants and diverse corn and sorghum from around the world. So many hopes and dreams for all these little kernels. Hope they do great!

entry.title: RNAseq workshop at CSHL!
entry.content: I had a blast teaching at the Cold Spring Harbor Workshop on Cereal Genomics! I couldn’t stay for long, but Dave Jackson, Doreen Ware and Sarah Hake put together a great class with a great diversity of students and cutting-edge lecturers! I helped out with the class on gene expression. Andrea Eveland from the Donald Danforth Center Plant Science Center gave an amazing lecture on all the ways that gene expression data can inform plant science. Then we did a hands-on command line RNAseq analysis– from raw reads to developmental inference. You can find the course materials here.

entry.title: Leiboff publishes a paper!
entry.content: Check out our new research on the gene expression dynamics of developing maize and sorghum panicles in Current Biology. I had a lot of fun dissecting, imaging, and performing RNA sequencing on so many immature maize and sorghum inflorescences. They’re beautiful up close!
